001/*******************************************************************************

003 * image processing published by Springer-Verlag in various languages and editions.

008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.math.testing;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
013
014import imagingbook.common.math.MahalanobisDistance;
015import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
016import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm;
017
018@Deprecated                     // move to tests!
019public class MahalanobisTest1 {
020
021        public static void main(String[] args) {
022                /*
023                 * Test example from Burger/Burge 3rd edition (Appendix D):
024                 * N = 4 samples, K = 3 dimensions
025                 */
026
027                double[] X1 = {75, 37, 12};
028                double[] X2 = {41, 27, 20};
029                double[] X3 = {93, 81, 11};
030                double[] X4 = {12, 48, 52};
031
032                System.out.println("X1 = " + Matrix.toString(X1));
033                System.out.println("X2 = " + Matrix.toString(X2));
034                System.out.println("X3 = " + Matrix.toString(X3));
035                System.out.println("X4 = " + Matrix.toString(X4));
036                System.out.println();
037
038                double[][] samples = {X1, X2, X3, X4};
039
040                MahalanobisDistance mhd = new MahalanobisDistance(samples);
041
042                double[] mu = mhd.getMeanVector();
043                System.out.println("mu = " + Matrix.toString(mu));
044                System.out.println();
045
046                // covariance matrix cov (3x3)
047                double[][] cov = mhd.getCovarianceMatrix();
048                System.out.println("cov = \n" + Matrix.toString(cov));
049                System.out.println();
050
051                double[][] icov =  mhd.getInverseCovarianceMatrix();
052                System.out.println("icov = \n" + Matrix.toString(icov)); 
053                System.out.println();
054
055                System.out.format("MH-dist(X1,X1) = %.3f\n", mhd.distance(X1, X1));
056                System.out.format("MH-dist(X1,X2) = %.3f\n", mhd.distance(X1, X2));
057                System.out.format("MH-dist(X2,X1) = %.3f\n", mhd.distance(X2, X1));
058                System.out.format("MH-dist(X1,X3) = %.3f\n", mhd.distance(X1, X3));
059                System.out.format("MH-dist(X1,X4) = %.3f\n", mhd.distance(X1, X4));
060                System.out.println();
061
062                System.out.format("MH-dist(X1,mu) = %.3f\n", mhd.distance(X1, mu));
063                System.out.format("MH-dist(X1)    = %.3f\n", mhd.distance(X1));
064                System.out.format("MH-dist(X2,mu) = %.3f\n", mhd.distance(X2, mu));
065                System.out.format("MH-dist(X2)    = %.3f\n", mhd.distance(X2));
066                System.out.format("MH-dist(X3,mu) = %.3f\n", mhd.distance(X3, mu));
067                System.out.format("MH-dist(X3)    = %.3f\n", mhd.distance(X3));
068                System.out.format("MH-dist(X4,mu) = %.3f\n", mhd.distance(X4, mu));
069                System.out.format("MH-dist(X4)    = %.3f\n", mhd.distance(X4));
070                System.out.println();
071
072                VectorNorm L2 = new VectorNorm.L2();
073                System.out.format("L2-distance(X1,X2) = %.3f\n", L2.distance(X1, X2));
074                System.out.format("L2-distance(X2,X1) = %.3f\n", L2.distance(X2, X1));
075
076                // ------------------------------------------------------
077
078                System.out.println();
079                System.out.println("Testing pre-transformed Mahalanobis distances:");
080                RealMatrix U = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(mhd.getWhiteningTransformation());
081                System.out.println("whitening transformation U = \n" + Matrix.toString(U.getData()));
082
083                double[] Y1 = U.operate(X1);
084                double[] Y2 = U.operate(X2);
085                double[] Y3 = U.operate(X3);
086                double[] Y4 = U.operate(X4);
087                double[] muT = U.operate(mu);
088
089                System.out.println("Y1 = " + Matrix.toString(Y1));
090                System.out.println("Y2 = " + Matrix.toString(Y2));
091                System.out.println("Y3 = " + Matrix.toString(Y3));
092                System.out.println("Y4 = " + Matrix.toString(Y4));
093
094                System.out.println();
095                System.out.format("whitened L2-distance(Y1,Y2) = %.3f\n", L2.distance(Y1, Y2));
096                System.out.format("whitened L2-distance(Y1,Y3) = %.3f\n", L2.distance(Y1, Y3));
097                System.out.format("whitened L2-distance(Y1,Y4) = %.3f\n", L2.distance(Y1, Y4));
098                
099                System.out.println();
100                System.out.format("whitened L2-distance(Y1,muT) = %.3f\n", L2.distance(Y1, muT));
101                System.out.format("whitened L2-distance(Y2,muT) = %.3f\n", L2.distance(Y2, muT));
102                System.out.format("whitened L2-distance(Y3,muT) = %.3f\n", L2.distance(Y3, muT));
103                System.out.format("whitened L2-distance(Y4,muT) = %.3f\n", L2.distance(Y4, muT));
104        }
105}
106
107/*

109X2 = {41.000, 27.000, 20.000}
110X3 = {93.000, 81.000, 11.000}
